Meaning: To Be Disconnected, To Come Off, To Be Off

Context Sentence EN: When I was a kid, my dad always told me that real men stay faithful, but he ended up cheating on my mom and now they’re going to get a divorce.

Context Sentence EN: I graduated from Tofugu Academy in 2014.

Context Sentence EN: Many students from Kwansei Gakuin University get to study abroad while at college.

Context Sentence EN: "What if I got fat again? " "Well, our relationship wouldn’t end, that’s for sure."

Context Sentence EN: Your cell phone was left somewhere around here.

Context Sentence EN: Darin discovered the dead body of a blowfish, lying in front of the Tofugu office.

Context Sentence JP: 転がる石？イギリスのロックバンド、ザ・ローリング・ストーンズのことですか？
Context Sentence EN: A rolling stone? Do you mean the English rock band The Rolling Stones?

Context Sentence JP: わたしは自転車で会社に行っています。
Context Sentence EN: I go to work by bike.

Context Sentence JP: 自転車を買ってあげるよ。お返しは要らないからね！
Context Sentence EN: I'll buy you a new bicycle, no strings attached.

Context Sentence JP: 「ごめん。てっきり君が僕の自転車を壊したのかと思ってたよ。」 「何それ！ひどい。私がそんなことするはずないでしょ。」
Context Sentence EN: "I’m sorry. I thought for sure you were the one who broke my bike." "What? That’s awful. You know me better than that."

Context Sentence EN: I really like driving around aimlessly when I’m on holiday.

Context Sentence JP: 運転する時は、ぜっ対に後ろはふり返りません。サメと同じで、前しか見ないんです。
Context Sentence EN: I never look back when I drive. I'm like a shark—only looking forward.

Context Sentence JP: このフグモデルの車は最高だね！とても気に入ったよ。毎日運転するのが待ち遠しいよ。
Context Sentence EN: This Fugu model car is amazing! I love it! I can’t wait to start driving it every day.

Context Sentence JP: そのメール、私にも転送してくれない？
Context Sentence EN: Could you forward that email to me?

Context Sentence EN: Japanese people who reside overseas often buy things from Japanese websites and have them forwarded to the foreign addresses.

Context Sentence JP: 郵便物をこちら住所の方へ転送して頂きたいんですが。
Context Sentence EN: Could you please forward my mail to this address?

Context Sentence EN: My pet hamster is vigorously rotating his hamster wheel.

Context Sentence JP: あそこの回転ずし、もう行った？なんか、そこのすししょく人は皿がきらいらしく、すしが回転してあつくなってるコンベアベルトの上に直でおかれているらしいよ。
Context Sentence EN: Have you been to the conveyer belt sushi restaurant over there? Apparently their sushi chefs hate plates there, so the sushi is directly on the rotating, hot conveyor belt.

Context Sentence EN: The moon revolves around the earth and the earth revolves around the sun.

Context Sentence EN: Are you making any progress in your work?

Context Sentence EN: Tofugu always goes one step ahead, doesn't it?

Context Sentence EN: Your daughter is advancing faster than the other students.

Context Sentence EN: Thanks to you all, Tofugu made such tremendous progress.

Context Sentence EN: Jeez, you’re really dumb. Darwin’s theory of evolution is not the title of a Disney movie.

Context Sentence JP: げんざい、六つのプロジェクトが進行中です。
Context Sentence EN: Six projects are currently progressing.

Context Sentence JP: おいしゃさんに、進行がんがあると言われました。
Context Sentence EN: The doctor told me that I have advanced cancer.

Context Sentence EN: Rest in peace iPhone. I just dropped it in a toilet filled with more than just water. Maybe this was just fate but I am so sad right now.

Context Sentence EN: We have to follow the every command of King Koichi.

Context Sentence EN: I like seeing couples walk along the seashore in yukata on days when there are fireworks.

Context Sentence EN: Do you remember who said, "It is a thousand times better to have common sense without education than education without common sense?"

Context Sentence EN: Oh, you’re color blind, eh? So that means you can’t point at which one is red and which one is green, then.

Context Sentence EN: Wow. It's already been a month since I took the lesson of drawing fingers last time, huh?

Context Sentence EN: There is a designated smoking area over there, so you should go there and complain how stinky smokers are instead of just telling me.

Context Sentence EN: You should get dressed really quickly or you’ll be late for school.

Context Sentence EN: The Tofugu team is planning a company retreat to travel across the Pacific Ocean on a luxury cruise.

Context Sentence JP: 冷ぞうこの中の太平洋クロマグロは、カナエちゃんのお土産です。
Context Sentence EN: That Pacific bluefin tuna in the fridge is Kanae's souvenir.

Context Sentence EN: Nowadays, most pufferfish are harvested in the spring during the spawning season, then farmed in floating cages in the Pacific Ocean.

Context Sentence JP: この洋食レストランは、有名なすし屋が共同して立ち上げたものです。
Context Sentence EN: The Western food restaurant was made in cooperation with famous sushi restaurants.

Context Sentence JP: いわゆる昔ながらの洋食屋さんで、バイトをしています。
Context Sentence EN: I'm working part-time at a so-called old fashioned Western family restaurant.

Context Sentence JP: ええっ！あそこのレストランで洋食ランチセットを食べたの？ははは。どおりでまだお腹がいっぱいなはずだわ。
Context Sentence EN: Oh, did you eat the western-style lunch set at that restaurant? Hahaha. No wonder you still feel full.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチの発言で、洋室にいた全いんがこおりついてしまった。
Context Sentence EN: When Koichi made that comment, everybody in the western style room froze.

Context Sentence JP: この洋室、はじめて来た場所なのに、なんだかよく知ってる部屋のような気がする。
Context Sentence EN: This western style room looks strangely familiar, though I know I've never been here before.

Context Sentence JP: 私の部屋は六畳の洋室で、壁の色は私の好きな水色です。
Context Sentence EN: My room is a western style room, about ten square meters, with my favorite color of light blue on the walls.

Context Sentence EN: Do you believe in gods?

Context Sentence EN: How much longer will you make God wait?

Context Sentence EN: God may be able to walk on water. But I can swim on land.

Context Sentence JP: これは、神道のぎしきの一つです。
Context Sentence EN: This is one Shinto ritual.

Context Sentence EN: Last night, I had a dream that I was just explaining Shinto to Koichi forever.

Context Sentence JP: どうして神道には絶対的な神がいないのですか。

Context Sentence JP: よぉ、中々イケてる自撮りじゃん。でも、お前、なんで学校じゃなくて神社になんていたんだよ？
Context Sentence EN: Yo! Very cool selfie, but why were you in a shinto shrine instead of at school?

Context Sentence JP: コウイチにラインしたら秒で返事きてわらえた。

Context Sentence EN: When I go to bed, I usually fall asleep in three seconds.

Context Sentence EN: Your pronunciation can reach native-level in just twelve seconds.

Context Sentence EN: The high level version of WaniKani sold really well and made the Tofugu name increase in value.

Context Sentence EN: Let me buy you some high class tea.

Context Sentence EN: This high end restaurant is for VIPs only. In order to enter, you need an invitation or a letter of referral.

Meaning: Beginner Level, Elementary Level, Beginning Level

Context Sentence EN: No way! Are you reading that book too? I’ve just finished chapter two. Don’t tell me anything if you’re farther than me.

Meaning: Tokyo Metropolis, Tokyo Metro, Tokyo Metropolitan Area, Tokyo Metro Area

Context Sentence EN: The leaves started falling earlier this year than last year in Tokyo Metro’s Sumida Ward, where the Tokyo Sky Tree stands.

Context Sentence EN: When I go to Kyoto, I want to eat tofu skin.

Context Sentence EN: Something moved over there.

Context Sentence EN: I don't like animals.

Context Sentence EN: Koichi hosted a party at the Tofugu Zoo for one hundred very important animals and for some reason, I wasn’t invited. I thought I was one of the VIA to him too.

Context Sentence EN: I feel like I haven't had enough exercise recently.

Context Sentence EN: I want to exercise, but I don't have time.

Context Sentence EN: I read neither books, nor newspapers, nor magazines because I like exercising more than reading.

Context Sentence EN: Let's go into business and make a fortune together!

Context Sentence EN: After leaving school I went into business for myself, but I soon learned that running a business is no easy task.

Context Sentence JP: 商人の血がさわぎます。
Context Sentence EN: As a merchant, I'm thrilled.

Context Sentence EN: My dad is a wholesale trader.

Context Sentence EN: He told me that he was a shopkeeper, but I found out that he was actually a poor homeless man who supported himself by collecting empty cans.

Context Sentence EN: This all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant's customer service is unbelievably bad.

Context Sentence EN: Sorry to bother you, but can you steam these veggies for me?

Context Sentence EN: The milk went bad, but I didn’t care.

Context Sentence EN: Koichi is just playing an evildoer.

Context Sentence JP: お前、本当に善人と悪人を区別することが可能だと思っているのか？
Context Sentence EN: Do you really think it’s possible to differentiate between good people and bad people?

Context Sentence JP: 今日は最悪な一日だったよ。
Context Sentence EN: Today was the worst day ever.

Context Sentence JP: 最悪、すいみん時間をけずって仕事をしなければならないですが、まぁなんとかなるでしょう。
Context Sentence EN: The worst case scenario is that I just have to sleep less and work, but it'll be okay.

Context Sentence EN: "My car was stolen last night." "Oh, no! That’s the worst!"

Context Sentence EN: My family grows a lot of vegetables in our garden, things like cucumbers, tomatoes, and zucchinis.

Context Sentence EN: When a member of an employee's immediate family dies, the employee is entitled to leave on any normal working day that falls within the three-day period immediately following the day the death occurred.

Context Sentence JP: 今度、俺の日本への家族旅行のことを君に話したいな。
Context Sentence EN: I wanna tell you about my family vacation in Japan some time.

Context Sentence EN: I don't want to lose my racial identity.

Context Sentence EN: My dad isn’t a blood relative but I still think of him as my real dad.

Context Sentence EN: What's up this late at night?

Context Sentence EN: Jealousy is the deepest sin of human sins.

Context Sentence EN: What was the formula for the volume of a sphere?

Context Sentence EN: The symbol of Expo ’70 was the Tower of the Sun, created by Taro Okamoto, and it’s still standing in the Expo Commemoration Park in Suita, Osaka, Japan.

Context Sentence JP: 引っ越しって、色々事務手続きがあって結構面倒くさい上に、対応の悪い担当者とかもいたりするよね。でも、今回の引っ越しで最悪だったのは、引っ越しの日にエレベーターが故障中だったことだよ。俺の部屋、四十二階なのに。
Context Sentence EN: It’s pretty annoying that there’s a lot of bureaucratic red tape involved in moving, and to make matters worse, sometimes the person in charge has an attitude problem. However, the worst part of my moving this time was that the elevator was out of service when I moved in and my apartment was on the forty-second floor.

Context Sentence JP: 寒すぎてふとんから出られない。
Context Sentence EN: It's too cold to get out of bed.

Context Sentence EN: I had to wait an hour in this cold for the bus.

Context Sentence EN: I’m going to Hawaii not only to escape the cold, but to see my family.

Context Sentence JP: それは悲しすぎるね。
Context Sentence EN: That's too sad.

Context Sentence EN: Sadly, I feel like I've just used up all my luck for it.

Context Sentence EN: When you feel sad, Momo, neither your dad nor myself are happy.

Context Sentence EN: It's so hot I'm about to melt.

Context Sentence EN: It has been hot these days in Japan.

Context Sentence JP: クソ暑いし蒸し蒸しするしたまんねぇな！この暑さでは寝られないよ。プールに行こうぜ！
Context Sentence EN: It’s too hot and humid! I can’t sleep in this heat. Let’s go to the pool!

Context Sentence JP: あの大学院生には、もっと期待してたのに。
Context Sentence EN: I expected more from the grad student.

Context Sentence EN: The new snack that I bought and had sent all the way from Japan the other day was not as good as I anticipated.

Context Sentence EN: Wall Street always needs top-level talent and I’m pretty sure that Koichi will be able to live up to those expectations.

Context Sentence JP: 次の学期にもフグと日本語と着物のクラスをとるつもりです。
Context Sentence EN: I am planning to take Japanese and kimono classes with Fugu next semester as well.

Context Sentence JP: この学期が終わったら、コウイチとコウイチ子はハワイでけっこんしきをあげる予定です。
Context Sentence EN: After this term ends, Koichi and Koichiko will have their wedding ceremony in Hawaii.

Context Sentence JP: 学期末試験は三月なので、まだまだ勉強する時間はたっぷりあります。
Context Sentence EN: Final exams are held in March so there's still plenty of time to prepare.

Context Sentence EN: Why don't we just wait and see until the time is right?

Context Sentence EN: It’s just a phase Takeshi is going through. Don’t they say people living in a foreign country usually experience a period of culture shock?

Context Sentence EN: Apparently Koichi can understand what plants are saying.

Context Sentence EN: I don’t have a green thumb but I like to grow plants.

Context Sentence JP: 半年に一度は歯医者に行った方がいい。
Context Sentence EN: It's better to go see a dentist at least once every six months.

Context Sentence JP: 花田さんは、この歯医者にはもっ体ないよ。
Context Sentence EN: Ms. Handa is too good for this dentist.

Context Sentence JP: 彼はただ不良に憧れてるだけだと思うよ。絶対に本物の不良にはならないね。だって、歯医者さんに行くのですら怖がってるんだよ！
Context Sentence EN: I think he’s just a wannabe delinquent. I doubt he’ll end up being a real one because he’s still afraid of going to the dentist.

Context Sentence EN: Today, I had my decayed tooth extracted at the dentist.

Context Sentence EN: Streptococcus mutans bacteria, the cause of tooth decay, can be transferred from adults to the kids around them as they grow up.

Context Sentence JP: 虫歯がいっぱいあるんだけど、歯科保険が無いので、治療代を捻出することができないんだ。
Context Sentence EN: I have so many cavities but I don’t have dental insurance and I can’t afford to get them treated.

Context Sentence JP: 七本目の歯が生えてきました。
Context Sentence EN: Her seventh tooth came in.

Context Sentence JP: タバコのすいすぎで歯が黄色くなってしまった。
Context Sentence EN: I smoked so much that my teeth are yellow now.

Context Sentence JP: 電動歯ブラシを買うことを考えているんだが、どれも値段が高いんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: I’m thinking about buying one of those electric toothbrushes, but they’re so expensive.

Context Sentence JP: 何か温かいものが飲みたいなぁ。
Context Sentence EN: I want to drink something warm.

Context Sentence JP: 初心者なので、どうか温かい目で見まもってください。
Context Sentence EN: I'm a beginner, so please go easy on me.

Context Sentence JP: 「デザートに温かいアイスクリームはいかがですか？」 「いいえ、もう結構です。」
Context Sentence EN: "Would you like some warm ice cream for dessert?" "No, we’re all set."

Context Sentence JP: この温泉は、タトゥーのある人も入よくできます。
Context Sentence EN: This onsen is open for people with tattoos too.

Context Sentence EN: Let's go to the hot springs after sweating a little bit from some light exercise.

Context Sentence JP: 私の父も母も温泉が好きじゃありません。
Context Sentence EN: Neither my dad nor mom likes hot springs.

Context Sentence EN: I'm aware that I'm a loser who loves to just stay home and watch TV all day.

Context Sentence JP: あの負け犬が明日からおれの仕事を引きつぐとか、本当にがまんできないよ。
Context Sentence EN: I can't stand the fact that the loser is taking over my job tomorrow.

Context Sentence JP: この負け犬め！キモいんだよ！
Context Sentence EN: You are a loser and really creepy!

Context Sentence JP: 返事を待っていましたが、待ちぼうけを食らいました。
Context Sentence EN: I waited in vain for a response.

Context Sentence JP: おかげで、さびれたえきで、一時間も待ちぼうけをする羽目になったよ。
Context Sentence EN: Thanks to that, I was stood up for about an hour at a desolate station.

Context Sentence JP: 彼が待ちぼうけを食らったと思わないように、明日の会議が中止になったことを伝えてあげてくれるかな？
Context Sentence EN: Could you please tell him tomorrow’s conference has been cancelled so he won’t feel like he’s been stood up?

Meaning: Victory, Win, A Victory, A Win
Context Sentence JP: コウイチはベリーダンス対決でボロ勝ちした。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi won the belly dancing competition hands down.

Meaning: Victory, Win, A Victory, A Win
Context Sentence JP: 雪合せん日本代表はぎゃく転勝ちをおさめた。
Context Sentence EN: Japan's national snow ball fighting team made a comeback to clinch the victory.

Meaning: Victory, Win, A Victory, A Win
Context Sentence JP: 早い者勝ちなんだだから、急ごうよ！あのフグのキーホルダーすごく欲しいんだよね！この機会を逃したくないんだ。
Context Sentence EN: It’s first come, first served. Let’s get a move on! I really want the Fugu keychain. I don’t want to miss out on this chance.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチの赤ちゃんの名前が決定したら、すぐにお知らせしますね。
Context Sentence EN: Once they've decided on a name for Koichi's baby I'll let you know right away.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは、じゅう業いんのきゅうりょうを決定するけん利を持っている。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi has the right to decide his employee's salaries.

Context Sentence JP: クソワロタwwwこのテレビ番組クソほど面白いじゃねーかよ。俺の一番好きな番組に決定したわ。
Context Sentence EN: ROFL! This TV show is hilarious, man. I’ve decided that this is now my new favorite show.

Meaning: To Meet By Chance, To Meet Unexpectedly, To Come Across, To Encounter, To Run Into
Context Sentence JP: わたしたち、ちょっと出会うのが早すぎたみたいね。
Context Sentence EN: It looks like we happened to run into each other a little too early.

Meaning: To Meet By Chance, To Meet Unexpectedly, To Come Across, To Encounter, To Run Into
Context Sentence JP: きのうの夜、クラブで、れんあいかんじょうぬきでただ楽しみたいっていう男に出会ってさ、ハマっちゃいけないのは分かってるけど、めちゃくちゃタイプだったんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: Last night, I met a guy who's looking for no strings attached fun at a club and I know I shouldn't be into him, but he was really my type.

Meaning: To Meet By Chance, To Meet Unexpectedly, To Come Across, To Encounter, To Run Into
Context Sentence JP: 「ニコールって、今、付き合っている人いるの？」「ええ。エリックと1年間付き合っているわ。」「そうなんだ！彼とは、どこで出会ったの？」
Context Sentence EN: "Are you seeing anyone now, Nicole?" "Yes, I’ve been seeing Eric for a year." "Wow, where did you guys meet?"

Context Sentence JP: トーフグの考え方は、理かいに苦しみます。
Context Sentence EN: I struggle to understand Tofugu's way of thinking.

Context Sentence JP: はんざいに手をそめるようそそのかしてくるコウイチからの強れつなプレッシャーに苦しんでいます。
Context Sentence EN: I'm struggling under intense pressure from Koichi, who aided and abetted me in a crime.

Context Sentence JP: なぜ罪のない人が苦しんでいるのか。
Context Sentence EN: Why do innocent people suffer?

Context Sentence JP: 気付かないふりはしないでください。
Context Sentence EN: Don't pretend like you didn't notice.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチ子へのおもいに気付いたのはかの女と出会って三日目のことだったと思います。
Context Sentence EN: I think I realized my feelings for Koichiko three days after we met.

Context Sentence JP: あんたが私にアイスクリームをくれるなんて、本当に信じられないよ。あんたがそんなに優しいなんて今まで気付かなかったわ！
Context Sentence EN: I can’t believe you gave me your ice cream. I didn’t realize that you were so kind until now.

Meaning: To See Off, To Put Off, To Pass On
Context Sentence JP: 見送る方と見送られる方って、どっちの方がつらいんだろうね。
Context Sentence EN: I wonder which is harder, being the person who sees someone off or being one who is seen off by someone.

Meaning: To See Off, To Put Off, To Pass On
Context Sentence JP: コウイチは、彼らを見送った後、どっと涙の雨を流した。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi burst into tears after seeing them off.

Meaning: To See Off, To Put Off, To Pass On
Context Sentence JP: 彼は海外に行くチャンスを見送った。
Context Sentence EN: He passed up a chance to go abroad.

Context Sentence JP: 私は時々トーフグホテルの最上階のレストランでトーフグの記事を読みます。
Context Sentence EN: Sometimes I read Tofugu articles in a restaurant on the top floor of the Tofugu hotel.

Context Sentence JP: はま辺では、時々、そよ風がわたしのほほをやさしくなでていった。
Context Sentence EN: At the beach, sometimes a pleasant breeze would gently caress my cheek.

Context Sentence JP: トーフグって、時々お客さんともめるんだよね。あるトラブルが、死人を出すなぐり合いのけんかになったこともあるから、ほんと、気を付けた方がいいよ。
Context Sentence EN: Tofugu gets into trouble with its customers at times. One time it even led to a fist fight that ended in a death, so you should be careful with them, really.

Context Sentence JP: あの受付の女せい、左足に大きな魚の目があるらしいよ。
Context Sentence EN: I heard that receptionist lady has a big corn on her left foot.

Context Sentence JP: 明日から、シュワちゃんがトーフグの受付をしてくれます。
Context Sentence EN: Arnold Schwarzenegger will be Tofugu's receptionist starting tomorrow.

Context Sentence JP: え？知らない。受付で聞いてない？
Context Sentence EN: Huh? I don’t know. Didn't someone at reception explain it to you?

Context Sentence JP: わたしはスーパーで買い物をしています。
Context Sentence EN: I’m shopping at the grocery store.

Context Sentence JP: 買い物はいつもネットショッピングですませています。
Context Sentence EN: As for shopping, I usually just do it online.

Context Sentence JP: 今日はクリスマスの買い物に行くの！すごくワクワクするわ！
Context Sentence EN: We’re going Christmas shopping today! I’m so excited!

Meaning: Hard To Deal With, Weak Point, Poor At, Not Very Good At, Bad At
Context Sentence JP: ちんもくが苦手です。
Context Sentence EN: Silence is hard to deal with.

Meaning: Hard To Deal With, Weak Point, Poor At, Not Very Good At, Bad At
Context Sentence JP: 「コウイチが苦手なことって何ですか？」「ぼくは歌が苦手です。」
Context Sentence EN: "What is your weak point, Koichi?" "I'm not good at singing."

Meaning: Hard To Deal With, Weak Point, Poor At, Not Very Good At, Bad At
Context Sentence JP: 俺とお前は昔は切っても切れない仲だっただろ。でもさ、 ほら、今は昔とは違うというか何というか、えっと…正直いって、お前のこと苦手なんだよ。
Context Sentence EN: You and I used to be inseparable, but you know, now it’s like… things are different. Honestly, I feel uncomfortable with you.

Context Sentence JP: かれ氏は酒好きなんで、心配なんですよね。
Context Sentence EN: My boyfriend is a drinker, so I'm worried.

Context Sentence JP: あの酒好き、今日も朝から引っかけてやがるぜ。
Context Sentence EN: That alcoholic is drinking in the morning again today.

Context Sentence JP: 私の妻は酒好きなので、アル中にならないか心配だ。
Context Sentence EN: My wife is a drinker and I’m worried about her becoming an alcoholic.

Context Sentence JP: 子どものくせにスルメがすきだなんて、こりゃぁこの子はしょう来酒飲みになるねぇ。
Context Sentence EN: He likes dried cuttlefish, even though he is a kid, eh? He could be a boozer in the future.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチはお酒は好きだけど、酒飲みってほどじゃあないですよ。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi likes drinking, but he isn't like an alcoholic.

Context Sentence JP: 彼は大酒飲みだが、赤ワインが苦手だ。
Context Sentence EN: He’s a heavy drinker but he doesn’t like red wine.

Meaning: Animal Cry, Animal Sound, Animal Noise, Chirp, Tweet, Roar, Bark, Meow
Context Sentence JP: きりんの鳴き声を聞いたことがありますか。
Context Sentence EN: Have you ever heard what a giraffe sounds like?

Meaning: Animal Cry, Animal Sound, Animal Noise, Chirp, Tweet, Roar, Bark, Meow
Context Sentence JP: 外からコウイチの声が聞こえると思ったら、小鳥の鳴き声だった。
Context Sentence EN: I thought I heard Koichi outside, but it was a little bird's chirps.

Meaning: Animal Cry, Animal Sound, Animal Noise, Chirp, Tweet, Roar, Bark, Meow
Context Sentence JP: 自動販売機の下から子犬の鳴き声が聞こえるんです。
Context Sentence EN: I hear a puppy barking under the vending machine.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチの飲んでいる飲み物は何ですか？
Context Sentence EN: What's the drink that Koichi's drinking?

Context Sentence JP: にんしん中は、アルコールをふくんだ飲み物は飲んではいけない。
Context Sentence EN: Beverages containing alcohol shouldn't be drunk during pregnancy.

Context Sentence JP: 「何か冷たい飲み物はいかがですか？」「それでは、牛乳パックを二本頂けますか？」
Context Sentence EN: "Would you like something cold to drink?" "Well then, could I have two cartons of milk?"

Meaning: Hearable, Audible, To Be Able To Hear, To Be Heard, To Be Audible, Can Hear
Context Sentence JP: 聞こえたんだったら、ちゃんと返事してよ！
Context Sentence EN: If you could hear me, you should've said something!

Meaning: Hearable, Audible, To Be Able To Hear, To Be Heard, To Be Audible, Can Hear
Context Sentence JP: オナラ、聞こえちゃったよね？
Context Sentence EN: You heard my fart, didn't you?

Meaning: Hearable, Audible, To Be Able To Hear, To Be Heard, To Be Audible, Can Hear
Context Sentence JP: きつい言い方に聞こえることは分かってるんだけど、つまらない言い訳はしたくないの。
Context Sentence EN: I understand it sounds harsh, but I’m up to my neck in lame excuses.

Context Sentence JP: 心配事をわらいとばしてくれてありがとう。
Context Sentence EN: Thank you for laughing my cares away.

Context Sentence JP: なんだか心配事があるみたいだよ。
Context Sentence EN: Apparently he's got some worries.

Context Sentence JP: 私の一番の心配事は、町に降り落ちる火山灰です。
Context Sentence EN: My biggest worry is volcanic ash falling over the city.

Context Sentence JP: この漢字の音読みって何だっけ？
Context Sentence EN: What was the on'yomi for this kanji again?

Context Sentence JP: 初めて見た地名はふ通は音読みしちゃうよね。
Context Sentence EN: We usually read place names that we see for the first time with on'yomi.

Context Sentence JP: 日本語の音読みと訓読みの違いは何ですか？
Context Sentence EN: What’s the difference between the Chinese reading and the Japanese reading in the Japanese language?

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは仕事中、たまに想像できないような動きをする。
Context Sentence EN: Every once in a while Koichi will move in an unimaginable way while he's working.

Context Sentence JP: てらや神社をめぐってごしゅいんちょうにごしゅいんを集める仕事って、想像できる？
Context Sentence EN: Can you imagine having a job where you visit temples and shrines to collect their red ink stamps in a book?

Context Sentence JP: もし指を喉に突っ込む以外でゲロを吐く方法を学びたいなら、裸のコウイチを想像するといいよ。
Context Sentence EN: If you want to learn how to vomit without sticking your finger down your throat, just imagine Koichi naked.

Context Sentence JP: YouTubeでマイケルの映像を四千四百四十四回見ると、のろいにかかるらしいよ。
Context Sentence EN: I heard that if you watch Michael's video on YouTube 4444 times, you'll be cursed.

Context Sentence JP: 映画リングを見てからというもの、古い戸からさだ子が出てくる映像が頭からはなれない。
Context Sentence EN: Since I watched Ringu, I can't get the image of Sadako coming out of that old well out of my head.

Context Sentence JP: あの新しい日本映画見た？映画自体はいまいちだったんだけど、映像が物凄く美しかったよ。
Context Sentence EN: Did you see that new Japanese movie? The movie itself wasn’t very good, but the shots they captured were beautiful.

Context Sentence JP: 勝手にわたしの画像を使わないでくださいよ！
Context Sentence EN: Don't use my picture without my permission!

Context Sentence JP: けいさつにコウイチの暗殺事けんにかんするしょうこ画像をてい出しました。
Context Sentence EN: I submitted images as evidence to the police regarding Koichi's assassination case.

Context Sentence JP: 残念。この画像はちょっとボケてるので使えないよ。
Context Sentence EN: What a shame. This picture is a little out of focus so you can’t use it.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは東京に一億円のマンションを持っています。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi has a one-hundred-million yen condo in Tokyo.

Context Sentence JP: 日本という小さな島国に一億もの人が住んでいることがしんじられない。
Context Sentence EN: I can't believe that Japan, a tiny island country, has one hundred million people living on it.

Context Sentence JP: 宝くじで一億ドル当たったけど、私は既に兆万長者なので全部慈善活動に寄付したよ。
Context Sentence EN: I won a hundred million dollars in the lottery, but I donated it all to charity because I’m a trillionaire.

Context Sentence JP: 一億円とか大きな注文は入ってないけど、コンスタントに注文はあるよ。
Context Sentence EN: We don't get big orders of like one hundred million yen, but we do get steady orders.

Context Sentence JP: トーフグがわたしに一億円をめぐんでくれることが決定したというお知らせを受けとりました。
Context Sentence EN: I received a notification saying Tofugu had decided to donate one hundred million yen to me.

Context Sentence JP: 「さっき一億円が入ったスーツケースを無くしちゃったんだけど。」「えぇっ！見つかるといいね。」
Context Sentence EN: "I just lost a suitcase that had one hundred million yen in it.” "What! I hope you find it."

Context Sentence JP: このおく歯までしっかりとどく歯ブラシで、今年は五億円を売り上げました。
Context Sentence EN: We sold five hundred million yen worth of this reach toothbrush this year.

Context Sentence JP: あんなに小さかった子がこんなに大きくなって、今や毎年三億ドルをかせぐ大物になっているなんて、本当にしんじられないよ。
Context Sentence EN: I really can't believe that little kid has gotten so big and now earns three hundred million dollars every year.

Context Sentence JP: 出張の領収書は全部とっておいてください。経費は二億円までなら後で精算されますので。
Context Sentence EN: Please keep all the receipts from your business trip. You will be reimbursed for your business expenses later, as long as they’re under two hundred million yen.

Context Sentence JP: ワニカニの売り上げが落ちるのはトーフグにとって大きな問題です。
Context Sentence EN: It would be a big problem for Tofugu if WaniKani's revenue were to drop.

Context Sentence JP: この数学の問題、三十秒間どう考えても分からなかったからわたしの代わりにちょっとやっておいてくれない？
Context Sentence EN: I tried to solve this math question for thirty seconds and I couldn't figure it out, can you do it for me?

Context Sentence JP: 「お願いがあるんだけど。」「いいけど、何？」「週末、私の犬の世話をしてもらえないかな？」「問題ないよ。任せといて。」
Context Sentence EN: "Can you do me a favor?" "Sure, what is it?" "Can you look after my dog for the weekend?" "No problem. You can count on me."

Context Sentence JP: コウイチが本当に肉を食べられないかは疑問です。
Context Sentence EN: It's doubtful whether Koichi actually can't eat meat.

Context Sentence JP: 田代さんのあの日の行動には疑問がのこります。
Context Sentence EN: Mr. Tashiro's behavior on that day is questionable.

Context Sentence JP: フグ市長は好きですが、私たちの地域に何をしてくれたかって聞かれると、まだ疑問です。
Context Sentence EN: I like Mayor Fugu, but if you asked me what he's done for our community, I'm not really sure.

Context Sentence JP: この器は母の形見なんです。
Context Sentence EN: This vessel is a relic of my mom's.

Context Sentence JP: どうしよう？コウイチが大切にしていたフグの器をわってしまった。
Context Sentence EN: What should I do? I accidentally broke the container of blowfish that Koichi cherishes.

Context Sentence JP: まず最初にごはんを器に入れて、次にハンバーグをのせて、それからグレービーソースをかけて、最後に卵をのせたら…ジャーン！ロコモコの出来上がり！
Context Sentence EN: First you put some rice in a bowl, then you put a hamburger patty on the rice, followed by some gravy, and then an egg on top. Then, ta-da! Now, your Loco-moco is done!

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは手先がとても器用です。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi is very dextrous with his fingers.

Context Sentence JP: ビエトはワニカニの着ぐるみを着たまま、器用にコカ・コーラを飲んだ。
Context Sentence EN: Viet skillfully drank a coca cola while wearing a WaniKani mascot outfit.

Context Sentence JP: 彼女はいつも明るくて良い子なんだけど、あまり器用じゃないので、首にしようか迷ってるんです。
Context Sentence EN: She is always a cheerful and agreeable girl but she’s not very skilled with her hands, so I’m wondering if I should fire her.

Context Sentence JP: 楽器にも色々ありますが、どんな楽器が好きですか。私は打楽器が好きです。
Context Sentence EN: There are various different types of musical instruments. Which type do you like? I like percussion.

Context Sentence JP: まずは楽器を楽ふ通りにえんそうしてみてください。
Context Sentence EN: Please start by trying to play your instrument note for note.

Context Sentence JP: 「あなたのCDを持ってくるのを忘れてしまったわ。」「別にいいよ、またの機会で。でも、その代わりにBGMとして何か楽器を弾いてくれない。」
Context Sentence EN: "I forgot to bring your CD." "That’s okay. I can get it another time, but can you play an instrument for background music instead?"

Context Sentence JP: この食器をテーブルの上にならべてくれませんか。
Context Sentence EN: Can you arrange these plates and utensils on the table, please?

Context Sentence JP: あなたが池に落としたのはこの金の食器ですか、それともこの銀の食器ですか。
Context Sentence EN: Which utensils did you drop in the pond, the gold ones or the silver ones?

Context Sentence JP: どうして、食器が一式多いの？
Context Sentence EN: How come we have one extra place setting?

Context Sentence JP: 力士のサインがほしいなら両国に行ってみたら？
Context Sentence EN: If you want a sumo wrestler's autograph, why don't you go to Ryogoku?

Context Sentence JP: 初デートで、力士はずっと前がみをなでつけてたんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: The sumo wrestler kept patting down his bangs on our first date.

Context Sentence JP: お集まりの皆さん、本日は度重なる力士の不祥事に関する会議にご出席いただき有難うございます。
Context Sentence EN: Ladies and gentlemen, thank you for attending today’s conference regarding the repeated misconduct of our sumo wrestlers.

Context Sentence JP: ななめから見てるから、宿題の答えが見えづらいんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: It's hard to see the answers to your homework because I'm looking at it from an angle.

Context Sentence JP: 今日のわたしの宿題、ちょっと見てもらえないかな？
Context Sentence EN: Can you take a quick look at my homework from today, please?

Context Sentence JP: 「でも、ママ！僕…」「つべこべ言わないの。さあ、自分の部屋へ行って、宿題をしなさい。」
Context Sentence EN: "But, Mom! I..." "No buts. Now go to your room and do your homework."

Context Sentence JP: この新宿のホテルのシャワーは、水かぬるま湯しか出ない。
Context Sentence EN: This Shinjuku hotel's shower only has cold or lukewarm water.

Context Sentence JP: 新宿は毎年、わたしの行ってみたい場所ランキングの中で最下位です。
Context Sentence EN: Shinjuku is always dead last on my personal list of places I want to visit each year.

Context Sentence JP: 新宿二丁目は今はゲイタウンとして知られていますが、昔は危険な香りのする赤線地区でした。
Context Sentence EN: Shinjuku 2-chome is now known as a gay town but it used to be a sketchy red light district.

Context Sentence JP: 大人には大人の事情があるんですよ。
Context Sentence EN: Adults have adult circumstances.

Context Sentence JP: 警察はすべての事情を考慮しなければならない。
Context Sentence EN: The police must take all circumstances into account.

Context Sentence JP: サマンサはワニカニのサービス利用代金がはらえない事情を説明しました。
Context Sentence EN: Samantha explained the circumstances behind her inability to pay for using Wanikani.

Meaning: Human Feelings, Humanity, Empathy, Kindness, Sympathy
Context Sentence JP: 人情のあたたかさに生かされています。
Context Sentence EN: I survive on the warmth of humanity.

Meaning: Human Feelings, Humanity, Empathy, Kindness, Sympathy
Context Sentence JP: コウイチ様は人情味にあふれているすばらしいお方ですが、ビエト様はひとかけらの人情もないごく悪ヤクザです。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi-sama is such a wonderful person with deep empathy, but Viet is such a devilish yakuza with not one atom of humanity.

Meaning: Human Feelings, Humanity, Empathy, Kindness, Sympathy
Context Sentence JP: 私達はトーフグの毎日のブログ記事を通して、日本人の生き方や人情を描き出すことを目指しています。
Context Sentence EN: Our goal with the daily Tofugu articles is to depict human nature, emotions, and the everyday lives of Japanese individuals.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチ子は、コウイチが情けのかけらもない男だと知って、別れました。
Context Sentence EN: Koichiko broke up with Koichi after she learned Koichi is a man without even a shred of sympathy.

Context Sentence JP: 日本語には、「旅は道づれ世は情け」ということわざがあります。
Context Sentence EN: In Japanese there is a proverb, "It is important for us to be compassionate toward each other as we travel through this world."

Context Sentence JP: テストは70点が合格点だったが、私は69点だったのにも関わらずお情けで合格させてもらえた。
Context Sentence EN: I needed a 70 to pass the test, and even though I got a 69, I was given a pity pass.

Context Sentence JP: おこると感情のコントロールがうまく出来ません。
Context Sentence EN: I can't control my emotions well when I get mad.

Context Sentence JP: これは大事なことですから、感情に左右されずにれいせいにはんだんしてくださいね。
Context Sentence EN: This is important, so please judge it in good spirits rather than relying on your feelings.

Context Sentence JP: 感情に流されすぎてはいけないよ。自分の感情に負けることには何の価値もないよ。
Context Sentence EN: Do not give in too much to your feelings. There’s no point in letting your emotions get the better of you, right?

Context Sentence JP: わたしは未来を予想できるんです。
Context Sentence EN: I can predict the future.

Context Sentence JP: 今日もコウイチはちこくするであろうというわたしの予想は見事に外れてしまった。
Context Sentence EN: My prediction that Koichi would be late again today turned out to be completely wrong.

Context Sentence JP: 予想外の出来事が生じているため、今日は氷の舟で溶岩のプールを渡ることはできません。

Context Sentence EN: "Look, when it started I was just trying to be nice to Fugu because he was my big sister’s boyfriend. Then, one thing led to another and before I knew it, we were... raking fallen leaves together." "T-Tuna. Why would you do that?" "Salmon, wait. We only did it once. It didn’t mean anything to me."

Context Sentence EN: "Please eat it while it’s hot." "Thank you, but... well, it’s so hot that we can’t eat it yet."

Context Sentence EN: My husband's eye color is storm gray.

Context Sentence JP: 緑のじゅうたんとか、ちょっと悪しゅ味だよね。
Context Sentence EN: Choosing a green carpet shows you have pretty bad taste, right?

Context Sentence JP: A:「僕はこの赤いのが気に入ったよ。」 B:「私は緑の方がいいわ。」 A:「ああ、そうかい。じゃあ、好きなようにしろよ。」
Context Sentence EN: A: I like the red one. B: I prefer green. A: Oh. OK then, have it your way.

Context Sentence JP: この緑色なゆで玉子は、ちょっと食べる気になれませんね。
Context Sentence EN: This boiled, green egg makes you lose your appetite, doesn't it?

Context Sentence JP: これはかん全にこ人てきな好みなんですけど、コウイチにはかみを緑色にそめてもらいたいんですよねー。
Context Sentence EN: This is just my personal preference, but I want Koichi to dye his hair green.

Context Sentence JP: A:「このネクタイ、どうかな？」 B:「そうねぇ。こっちの緑色のをしてみてよ。」 A:「わかったよ。これでどう？」 B:「うん。そっちの方がいいわね。」
Context Sentence EN: A: How do you like this tie? B: Hmm... Here. Try this green one. A: Okay. How’s this? B: Yeah. That’s more like it.

Context Sentence JP: 一年間練習して、ようやく有気音とむ気音を聞き分けられるようになりました。
Context Sentence EN: After practicing for one year, was finally able to distinguish between aspirated and unaspirated sounds.

Context Sentence JP: 日々の練習が実をむすび、アドリブでギターがひけるようになりました。
Context Sentence EN: My daily practice bore fruit and now I can improvise on the guitar.

Context Sentence JP: 僕が世界ランキング一位を維持し続けているのは、日本語を毎日七時間練習しているからだと思います。
Context Sentence EN: I believe the reason I continue being ranked number one in the world is that I devote seven hours a day to practicing Japanese.

Context Sentence JP: 詩が大好きで、毎日詩を読んでいます。
Context Sentence EN: I like poems a lot, so I read them every day.

Context Sentence JP: わたしの心のやみを詩で表げんしてみたんだけど、ちょっと読んでみてくれない？
Context Sentence EN: I expressed the darkness of my mind in a poem. Can you take a look?

Context Sentence JP: 今日の宿題は、日本語で詩を書くことです。
Context Sentence EN: Today’s homework is to write a poem in Japanese.

Context Sentence JP: サーモンは今世紀を代表する詩人です。
Context Sentence EN: Salmon is a poet who represents the current century.

Context Sentence JP: わたしの友人に詩人が一人いるんですが、かれの家の中はかべ中詩でおおわれているんです。
Context Sentence EN: One of my friends is a poet, and poems take up space all over the walls in his house.

Context Sentence JP: 君は詩人で、暗喩を使うことが好きなのかもしれないけど、もっと分かりやすく話さないと相手はわからないよ。
Context Sentence EN: Even though you’re a poet and you like using metaphors, you have to speak clearer or people won’t understand you.

Context Sentence JP: 毎日詩歌を楽しんでいます。
Context Sentence EN: I enjoy poetry every day.

Context Sentence JP: フグにはすばらしい詩歌を作るかくれた才のうがあります。
Context Sentence EN: Fugu's secret skill is composing marvelous poetry.

Context Sentence JP: 詩歌とは日本の詩のことですが、一般的には漢詩や和歌、俳句のことを指します。
Context Sentence EN: Shiika means Japanese poetry and that generally includes kanshi, waka, or haiku.

Context Sentence JP: 先月、課長にしょう進しました。
Context Sentence EN: I got promoted to section manager last month.

Context Sentence JP: 課長になれたのはうれしいんだけど、ざん業代が出ないから実はきゅう料が下がったんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: I'm glad I was able to become a section chief, but my pay has actually decreased because I don't get paid for overtime.

Context Sentence JP: 課長が少しうざいんだよね。他の社員に良い印象を与えようといつも頑張っちゃってさ。
Context Sentence EN: My section manager is kind of annoying. He is always trying to impress the other workers.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチちゃんに今すぐ謝りなさい！
Context Sentence EN: Apologize to Koichi right now!

Context Sentence JP: 何も悪いことをしてないのに謝られるとぎゃくにこっちがこまります。
Context Sentence EN: If you apologize even though you haven't done anything wrong it makes me uncomfortable.

Context Sentence JP: 君が満足する結果が得られないのはかわいそうだけど、自分がしたことじゃないのに謝るつもりはないよ。
Context Sentence EN: I feel bad that you won’t get a satisfying result, but I refuse to apologize for something I didn’t do.

Context Sentence JP: 実はコウイチの首には賞金がかけられているって知っていましたか。
Context Sentence EN: Did you know that the prize money is actually on Koichi's head?

Context Sentence JP: ビエトは今回の日本旅行で当てたけい馬の賞金が一億円もあるらしい。
Context Sentence EN: I heard that Viet won a one-hundred-million yen cash prize from a horse race during his Japan trip this time.

Context Sentence JP: 私達は変顔コンテストの賞金をいつもらえるんですか？
Context Sentence EN: When do we get our prize money from the funny face competition?

Context Sentence JP: バイクの車輪が外れてしまいました。
Context Sentence EN: My motorcycle's tire came off.

Context Sentence JP: 暗殺のきょうきには車輪が使われたそうです。
Context Sentence EN: I heard that a car wheel was used in the assassination.

Context Sentence JP: 今日、ちょっと自転車貸してもらえないかな？今、車輪を取り替えてもらっているので、自分のが無いんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: Could I borrow your bike today? I don’t have mine right now because I’m having a tire replaced.

Context Sentence JP: 早くこの輪投げの輪をなげてくださいよ！
Context Sentence EN: Please throw this Quoits ring quickly!

Context Sentence JP: パーティーに行くと、友だちの輪が広がります。
Context Sentence EN: If I go to parties, my circle of friends expands.

Context Sentence JP: 天使たちは、それぞれの輪っかをキラキラさせながら、みんなで輪になって踊りました。
Context Sentence EN: The angels danced in a circle, each of their halos shining brightly.

Context Sentence JP: だれを殺人するかなんて、選べないよ。
Context Sentence EN: I can't choose who to kill.

Context Sentence JP: 先生の話を聞かずに、ずっとどっちの女の子を選ぼうか考えていました。
Context Sentence EN: I stopped listening to my teacher and just kept thinking about which girl to choose.

Context Sentence JP: 良いフグのコスチュームをお選びになりましたね。
Context Sentence EN: You chose a great Fugu costume.

Context Sentence EN: Who is that handsome pro athlete?

Context Sentence EN: These days, we can often see Japanese professional baseball players play in the major leagues.

Meaning: Pro Athlete, Sports Player, Professional Athlete
Context Sentence JP: コウイチは素晴らしい剣道の選手です。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi is magnificent pro kendo player.

Context Sentence JP: 海魚の体が大きいほど体内にたくさん水銀がたまっています。
Context Sentence EN: The larger the oceanic fish, the more mercury in its body.

Context Sentence JP: 水星と水銀はえい語で共にマーキュリーと言いますが、これはぐう然でしょうか。
Context Sentence EN: I wonder if it's a coincidence that we call both Mercury, the planet, and mercury, the substance, "mercury" in English.

Context Sentence JP: 昔はみんな水銀体温計をお尻に差し込んでいたんだよね。めっちゃうける。
Context Sentence EN: It’s so funny that people used to insert mercury thermometers into their butts.

Context Sentence JP: けっこん指わは、銀か金、どちらにする？
Context Sentence EN: For your wedding ring which would you prefer: silver or gold?

Context Sentence JP: いくつになっても銀せいひんがすきです。
Context Sentence EN: No matter how old I get, I still like silver things.

Context Sentence JP: 赤信号で、銀の軽トラが私の横に止まった。
Context Sentence EN: At the red light a silver pick-up truck pulled up alongside me.

Context Sentence JP: 初めにお伝えしていたように、これを銀色にぬり直してください。
Context Sentence EN: Please repaint this silver like I told you the first time.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチの銀色のヒゲをわたしに売ってくれませんか？
Context Sentence EN: Could you sell Koichi's silver mustache to me, please?

Context Sentence JP: 私のダンスの相手は、あの銀色のコスチュームを着たフグって男よ。
Context Sentence EN: My dance partner is that guy in the silver costume. His name is Fugu.

Context Sentence JP: 銀行にお金を下ろしに行かないといけないんです。
Context Sentence EN: I have to go to the bank to withdraw some cash.

Context Sentence JP: 一円を笑う者は一円に泣くということわざがあるので、銀行に一円をあずけに行くことにしました。
Context Sentence EN: There is a proverb that says someone who laughs over one yen will eventually cry over one yen, so I decided to go to the bank to put one yen in my account.

Context Sentence JP: 銀行を強盗した人は牢屋行きなのに、銀行が人々からお金を奪ったら、ボーナスがもらえるんだよ。それってすごく不公平じゃない？
Context Sentence EN: When people rob banks they go to prison. When banks rob people they get bonuses. It’s so unfair, isn’t it?

Context Sentence JP: 鏡の横の植木ばちに花を植えました。
Context Sentence EN: I planted a flower in a flower pot next to the mirror.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは毎日のように鏡の中の自分に向かって話しかけているあやしい人です。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi is a strange man who talks to himself in the mirror almost every day.

Context Sentence JP: 「今朝、鏡が盗まれたよ。数週間前に歯ブラシと櫛を盗まれたばかりなのに！」「まぁ、人生そんなもんだよ。」
Context Sentence EN: "My mirror was stolen this morning. I just had my toothbrush and comb stolen a few weeks ago!" "Well, that’s life."

Context Sentence JP: 友だちと話題のフグをかいに行きました。
Context Sentence EN: We went to buy the much-talked-about fugu.

Context Sentence EN: When I went to the office the next morning, everyone was talking about Koichi's wedding and his sudden divorce on the following day.

Context Sentence JP: ここまでは理解していただけたかと思うのですが。それでは、次の話題に移りましょうか。トマトは、原産地が南米なだけでなく、フグの一番好きな野菜でもあるってことは知っていましたか？
Context Sentence EN: I hope you’ve understood so far. All right, now let’s move on to the next topic. Did you know tomatoes are not only native to South America but they’re also Fugu’s favorite vegetable?

Context Sentence EN: Please God! I want to be fluent in Japanese.

Context Sentence EN: If you aren't an active member, please join!

Context Sentence EN: You should thank your husband sometimes. He has done a good job raising your family, hasn’t he?

Context Sentence JP: 養子の態度が悪いから、叱ってやったんだ。
Context Sentence EN: I scolded my adopted child because he has such a bad attitude.

Context Sentence EN: "Why are there so many cockroaches in this Japanese inn?" "I think it’s because of all the rain we’ve been getting."

Context Sentence EN: We are going to make a book that teaches the history of the main building from scratch.

Context Sentence JP: あの百貨店の本館で働いている店員は、別館で働いている人たちに比べて、なんか働かされてるって感じだった。愛想がやけに悪いっていうかさ。
Context Sentence EN: Lots of the people working in the main building of the department store act like someone is forcing them to work, compared to those working at the annex. They have awfully bad attitudes.

Context Sentence EN: Please get off the train at Shinjuku Station.

Context Sentence EN: There is a Tofugu pot sticker shop in front of Ueno Station that Koichi opened with one hundred million yen.

Context Sentence JP: ようやく直接お話することができてよかったです。まさか駅でバッタリお会いするなんて思ってもいませんでしたよ。
Context Sentence EN: It was nice finally talking to you in person. I never thought I would run into you at a station.

Context Sentence EN: I'm looking for an apartment in front of the station.

Context Sentence JP: なんで私に、駅前で撮ったこんな変な自撮り写メを送ってきたの？
Context Sentence EN: Why did you just send that weird looking selfie taken in front of the station to me?

Context Sentence JP: その駅員の黒目は普通の人よりも大きいと思います。
Context Sentence EN: I think that train station attendant's irises are larger than most people's.

Context Sentence EN: All the station employees here eat bowls of 280 yen kake soba for lunch.

Meaning: Train Station Employee, Train Station Staff, Train Station Attendant, Station Attendant, Station Employee
Context Sentence JP: あの駅員、こう見えてすっごくお金持ちなのよ。
Context Sentence EN: You couldn’t tell from looking at him, but that station attendant is a really rich guy.

Context Sentence EN: My favorite idol was selected to be a one-day train station master.

Context Sentence EN: Because the stationmaster and Mr. Kawada are best friends, I heard that he secretly gets discount on fares.

Context Sentence EN: Oh my God! Did the station master just spit on the train? Did you see that?

Context Sentence JP: 都合がつき次第、こちらかられんらくします。
Context Sentence EN: I'll get in touch with you as soon as possible.

Context Sentence JP: 都合次第では、コウイチのけっこんしきはえん期になるかもしれません。
Context Sentence EN: Depending on the circumstances, Koichi's wedding ceremony may be postponed.

Context Sentence EN: "Which day is convenient for you, Saturday or Sunday?" "It makes no difference to me."

Context Sentence EN: I miss Japanese erasers.

Reading: けしごむ, けしゴム
Context Sentence JP: トーフグチームは、コウイチのたん生日に、消しゴム付きのえんぴつを百本分プレゼントしました。
Context Sentence EN: The Tofugu team got one hundred pencils with rubbers on the end for Koichi's birthday present.

Reading: けしごむ, けしゴム
Context Sentence JP: 「コウイチ、お前に謝るチャンスをあげてもいいよ。」「何に謝れっていうんだよ、ビエト？ お前が俺をトーフグのオフィスから追放したことに対して謝れってか？」「そもそもお前が俺の消しゴムを盗んだからそうなったんだろ？いいから謝れよ！」
Context Sentence EN: "I could give you a chance to apologize to me, Koichi." "For what, Viet? For letting you throw me out of Tofugu office?" "It only happened because you stole my eraser! I need an apology!"

Context Sentence JP: 悪気がないのは知ってるけど、そういうことを言われるとこっちもきずつくんだよ？
Context Sentence EN: I know you don't have any evil intent, but please understand that we could get hurt if you say something like that.

Context Sentence JP: 悪気があってしたわけじゃないんですが、けっかてきにそういう風に感じさせてしまう事になって本当にごめんなさい。
Context Sentence EN: I didn't do it out of malice, but I'm really sorry that I made you feel that way.

Context Sentence JP: ところで、そもそも、何の経験もなくて、どうやってその職を得たの？あ、悪気は無いよ。
Context Sentence EN: By the way, how did you get the job without any experience in the first place? No offense, of course.

Context Sentence JP: 山登りがしゅ味なんですか？
Context Sentence EN: Is mountain climbing your hobby?

Context Sentence JP: ものしずかな友人と、山登りに行ってきました。
Context Sentence EN: I went to climb a mountain with my quiet friend.

Context Sentence JP: お互い色々あったんだけど、山登りをしながらじっくり話し合ってさ。なんと復縁することになったよ。
Context Sentence EN: Both of us have been through a lot, but we had a long talk while climbing a mountain and decided to get back together.

Context Sentence EN: Which popular phrase do you think will be chosen for this year's buzzword of the year?

Context Sentence EN: A lot of new catchphrases are born every year, huh?

Context Sentence EN: In the past few years, "meme" has become a popular word on the internet.

Context Sentence JP: 今時は「流行りの歌」って言うよね。「流行歌」っていうとなんかしょう和の歌よう曲って感じがする。
Context Sentence EN: We say "pop song" these days, so when I hear "popular song," it reminds me of popular songs from the Showa period.

Context Sentence JP: ツイッターでフォローして、最新の流行歌情ほうをチェックしてね。
Context Sentence EN: Follow our Twitter for updates on the latest popular songs.

Context Sentence JP: 私は、流行歌ではないけど良い曲を見つけるのが好きです。
Context Sentence EN: I like finding good music, but not necessarily popular songs.

Context Sentence JP: このレストランの料理は例外なくどれも美味しいです。
Context Sentence EN: All the dishes at this restaurant are delicious without exception.

Context Sentence JP: きわめて例外のケースをのぞいて、この病院がその手術に成功したのをほとんど見たことがありません。
Context Sentence EN: Except for a few exceptional cases, I haven't actually seen this hospital successfully complete the procedure.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチはいつも朝遅くまで寝ていますが、金曜日はスーツを着なくてはいけないので例外です。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi usually sleeps in, but Friday is an exception because he has to wear a suit.

Context Sentence JP: これはほんの一例にすぎません。
Context Sentence EN: This is just one example.

Context Sentence EN: As an example, you can't get skinnier by simply eating less rice and potatoes.

Context Sentence EN: After I hired Salmon as secretary, I found out that she was the type of person who has sudden emotional outbursts in the office. For example, she ripped the telephone from her desk and smashed it to pieces, just to name one small incident.

Meaning: For Example, For Instance, Supposing That
Context Sentence JP: 例えば、昔はすごく人気があったけど、今は落ちぶれてしまった人がいたとしましょう。

Context Sentence EN: As they sang a song that goes, "If I lie, I'll cut my pinky off and drink a thousand needles," they pinky promised to make pancakes on Sunday together.

Context Sentence EN: "She’s dating Mr. Giant Buddha Statue." "You could have fooled me. He's old enough to be her father."

Context Sentence EN: I'm the type of person who only trusts what they can actually see.

Context Sentence JP: もっと自信を持った方がいいよ！

Meaning: Traffic Light, Signal, Traffic Signal, Stoplight, Semaphore

Context Sentence EN: You stop at a red light and cross the street at a green light, okay?

Context Sentence JP: あぶないから、信号をむししてはいけませんよ。
Context Sentence EN: It's dangerous to ignore traffic lights, so don't do that okay?

Meaning: Traffic Light, Signal, Traffic Signal, Stoplight, Semaphore
Context Sentence JP: いいか、よく聞けよ。六つ目の信号で左折した後、八つ目の角まで歩いて右折したら、そこで会った人に向かってお尻を振るんだ。それが秘密のサインだからな。そしたら、奴はお前を俺たちのアジトまで連れて行ってくれるさ。
Context Sentence EN: Listen carefully. Turn left at the sixth traffic light, walk another eight blocks, turn right and shake your butt toward someone you will meet there. That’s the secret sign, okay? Then, he will take you to our hideout.

Context Sentence EN: My mother believes in Buddhism.

Context Sentence JP: 信心ぶって他人をひはんしてくるから、あの子のことあんまり好きじゃないんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: I don't really like her because she sanctimoniously criticizes people.

Context Sentence JP: 彼の家族はとても信心深くてスピリチュアルなので、他のお酒を飲まずにスピリッツだけ飲みます。
Context Sentence EN: His family is very religious and spiritual, so they don't drink any alcoholic drink other than spirits.

Context Sentence JP: トーフグチームは、コウイチの言うことを全めん的に信用しています。
Context Sentence EN: The Tofugu team completely trusts what Koichi says.

Context Sentence JP: 私は、掃除や料理、マッサージや寝る前の歌なんかで、妻から信用点をつけられていると思っていたが、なんと逆に離婚されてしまったよ。
Context Sentence EN: I thought I would score some points with my wife if I cleaned the house, made dinner, gave her a massage, and sung her to sleep, but instead she divorced me.

Context Sentence JP: あの変人が不信の目でおれのことを見てくるんだよ。
Context Sentence EN: That oddball is giving me a distrusting stare.

Context Sentence JP: ワニカニユーザーのトーフグへの不信はつのるばかりだった。
Context Sentence EN: WaniKani users' distrust of Tofugu just keeps getting stronger.

Context Sentence JP: 新しい日本語学習教材を部分的に公開することは、我々の会社が何か事実を隠蔽しようとしているとの不信を招くかもしれないじゃないですか？
Context Sentence EN: Don’t you think that only partial release of the new Japanese learning material may feed suspicion that our company is covering up some facts?

Context Sentence JP: やばい、返信するのわすれてた。ちょっと大変なことになってしまうかも。
Context Sentence EN: Oh no, I forgot to reply. What have I gotten myself into?

Context Sentence JP: き読になったのに、いつまでたっても返信が来ないんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: It said "read," but I never got a reply.

Context Sentence JP: お疲れ〜。返信したつもりだったんだけど、どうやら力尽きて、送信ボタンを押す前に寝てたみたい。ごめんね、許して〜。
Context Sentence EN: How’s it going? I thought I sent a reply to you, but it seems that I was too tired and fell asleep before pressing the ’send’ button. Sorry. Forgive me.

Context Sentence JP: ワニカニユーザーは、コウイチのスピーチに勇気づけられました。
Context Sentence EN: WaniKani users were encouraged by Koichi's speech.

Context Sentence JP: 他の人の意見に反対するにはふ通は勇気がいると思うけど、トーフグで働いている時はそんな心配はいらないよ。
Context Sentence EN: It usually takes courage to oppose other people, but you don't have to worry about that when you work at Tofugu.

Context Sentence JP: 「フグ、私のお父さんは素晴らしい人だったのよ。いつも私に、流れに逆らって泳ぐには力と勇気が必要だ。浮かぶだけなら死んだ魚でもできるって言ってたわ。」「サーモン、それって、サミュエル・スマイルズの名言じゃなかったっけ。」
Context Sentence EN: "Fugu, my dad was a great person. He always told me that it requires strength and courage to swim against the stream, while any dead fish can float with it." "Salmon, isn’t that a quote by Samuel Smiles?"

Context Sentence JP: 私のおじは、中央区の区役所で働いています。
Context Sentence EN: My uncle works at the ward office of Chuo-ku.

Context Sentence JP: ここはちゅう車きん止区なので、車は止められませんよ。
Context Sentence EN: You cannot park here because this is a no-parking district.

Context Sentence JP: ここ最近、横浜の外国人居留区では、暴力行為がかつてないほど横行している。
Context Sentence EN: Recently, the foreign quarter of Yokohama has suffered from an unprecedented level of violence.

Context Sentence JP: この町では、校区が三つに区分されています。
Context Sentence EN: In this town, the school district is divided into three divisions.

Context Sentence JP: これは予算区分の問題なので、私にはどうしようもありません。
Context Sentence EN: This is a problem of budget classification, so there's nothing I can do.

Context Sentence JP: 私は、テロ行為と合法的な戦争を区分する必要は無いと思います。
Context Sentence EN: I don’t think it’s necessary to distinguish terrorism from legitimate warfare.

Context Sentence JP: 来月から、この地区のたん当者が変わるので、あらかじめお知らせさせていただきます。
Context Sentence EN: I would like to inform you in advance that the person in charge of this zone will change next month.

Context Sentence JP: この地区には、りん時ふくしきゅう付金を受きゅうしている人が三十八人います。
Context Sentence EN: There are thirty-eight people who receive provisional welfare benefits in this district.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは、近日中に地区検察局に自白内容を収めたビデオテープを送ることを計画しているようですよ。
Context Sentence EN: It seems that Koichi is planning to give a videotaped confession to the district attorney’s office soon.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは単に大変な努力家なだけですよ。
Context Sentence EN: It's simply because Koichi is a very hard worker.

Context Sentence JP: 「トーフグは、私にとっては単にお金をかせぐためのものではないんです。トーフグこそが私の人生なんです。」と、コウイチは言った。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi said, "To me, Tofugu is not merely for earning money. It's my life."

Context Sentence JP: 剣道では、単に相手を倒すことだけではなく、自らの心を鍛えることも重要です。
Context Sentence EN: In kendo, it’s important not simply to defeat your opponent but also to train your own mind.

Context Sentence JP: 日本語の単語の単語ちょうを作りました。
Context Sentence EN: I made a notebook for Japanese vocabulary.

Context Sentence JP: 単語の意味が分からない時は、じしょを引きます。
Context Sentence EN: When I don't know the meaning of a word, I look it up in my dictionary.

Context Sentence JP: 日本語の単語ゲーム作ったんだけど、やってみない？
Context Sentence EN: I created a Japanese word game. Do you want to try?

Context Sentence JP: その上司のコートは、とても丈夫な生地で出来ていました。
Context Sentence EN: That boss' coat was made of very durable material.

Context Sentence JP: うちの上司は、日本のれきしに大変きょう味があるようです。
Context Sentence EN: It seems that my superior is very interested in Japanese history.

Context Sentence JP: シャークがあなたのこと、名ばかりの上司だと言ってましたよ。
Context Sentence EN: Shark said you are the boss in name only.

Context Sentence EN: That temple stands at the top of this hill.

Context Sentence EN: Viet likes going down gentle slopes on his bicycle.

Context Sentence EN: The Tofugu baseball team has been on a downward slope since it lost its star player, Fugu.

Context Sentence JP: はしらのかげに変な人がいると思ったらただのコウイチだった。
Context Sentence EN: I thought there was a strange man behind the pole, but it was just Koichi.

Context Sentence JP: 同じ仕事をしているのに男性の方が女性よりきゅう料が高いなんてぜっ対に変だよ！
Context Sentence EN: It's absolutely absurd that men get higher pay than women despite doing the same work!

Context Sentence EN: That’s strange. I can’t find the email you say you sent me anywhere in my mailbox.

Context Sentence EN: Did you see what's in that weirdo's closet?

Context Sentence EN: I challenged myself to set a new world record for acting like an oddball, but I was ten minutes shy.

Context Sentence JP: あなたの上司はちょっと変人ですが、すぐに馴染めると思いますよ。
Context Sentence EN: Your boss is a little eccentric but I think you’re going to fit right in.

Context Sentence EN: Koichi is very sensitive about changes in the weather and he often gets migraines on rainy days.

Context Sentence EN: Tokyo has changed a lot since I visited ten years ago.

Context Sentence JP: うわ！すごいね。既に変化が現れているのが分かるよ。
Context Sentence EN: Wow! This is amazing! I can see the change already.

Context Sentence EN: The police are investigating Koichi's unnatural death.

Context Sentence JP: 「なんかパニクってるけど、どうしたの？」「コウイチは変死して、トーフグがとうさんするって聞いたんだよ。最悪だよ。」
Context Sentence EN: "You look upset. Is everything alright?" "I just heard that Koichi died an accidental death and Tofugu went bankrupt. It’s a nightmare."

Context Sentence EN: The news that Koichi met a mysterious and unnatural death shocked the nation.

Context Sentence EN: Acquiring Japanese is difficult, but do your best!

Meaning: Serious, Terrible, Very, Difficult, Hard, Hectic

Meaning: Serious, Terrible, Very, Difficult, Hard, Hectic
Context Sentence JP: 災害時は、電話回線もネット回線も混み合って、繋がりづらくなるので、ブログの更新が大変です。
Context Sentence EN: When there's a disaster, the phone and Internet circuits are overloaded and it gets hard to connect to them, so it's difficult to upload new blog posts.

Context Sentence EN: What year did Shanghai Incident occur?

Context Sentence EN: Can you explain what the Manchurian Incident is?

Context Sentence EN: My husband has very healthy teeth.

Context Sentence EN: My husband is such a wonderful man.

Context Sentence JP: ほら、また始まった。あんたって本当にいつも自分の夫の不満ばかり言っているよね。
Context Sentence EN: There you go again, always complaining about your husband.

Context Sentence EN: Let's race and see which one of us can make it to that boulder first.

Context Sentence EN: At Tofugu, there is a rule that people should leave Koichi alone when his face looks like a boulder.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチは、夢の中で大きな岩が頭上に落ちてくるところで、目が覚めた。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi woke up as a huge boulder fell toward him in a dream.

Context Sentence EN: I couldn't figure out the answer to the question asking to put the word "to like" in the past tense, so I just went home.

Context Sentence EN: "I’m hungry and my legs are sore," Bilbo said, just before turning to return home to the Shire.

Context Sentence EN: This man is well known for building very sturdy houses.

Context Sentence EN: The king built an unbelievably beautiful castle on top of the mountain.

Context Sentence EN: Our company is saving money to build a school for children in another country.

Context Sentence EN: The building constructed by that company doesn't meet current quake-resistance standards.

Context Sentence EN: Can I see a breakdown of these construction costs, please?

Context Sentence EN: Many people are fascinated by the traditional architecture found in places like Kyoto and Nara and I’m one of them.

Context Sentence EN: The ritual was boring, so I killed time by solving a bunch of equations.

Context Sentence EN: I don't like bugs, so I don't like spring.

Context Sentence EN: "How did your team do in the spring tournament?" "Hehe. Epic win."

Context Sentence EN: I heard the reason the character for "spring" is used for spring roll is because people used to make spring rolls with vegetables that sprout in spring.

Context Sentence EN: During the spring holiday promotion, admission is only 1,000 yen for students.

Context Sentence JP: 春休み中だったら、この時間たいは空いてます。
Context Sentence EN: Any of these times during spring vacation would work for me.

Meaning: Spring Break, Spring Vacation, Spring Holiday
Context Sentence JP: そろそろ風邪治った？春休みに風邪引くなんて最悪だよね。もしまだ辛いなら、夜更かししちゃだめだよ。早く良くなってね。
Context Sentence EN: Are you over your cold yet? It sucks having a cold during spring break, eh? If it’s still bad, don’t stay up late. Get well soon.

Context Sentence JP: 昨今はあなたの様な大物にお目にかかれることはめったになくなりましたよ、コウイチさん。
Context Sentence EN: Nowadays it is very rare to meet somebody big like you, Mr. Koichi.

Context Sentence EN: Owing to recent trends, Koichi decided to have a Shiba-inu and a Jindo in our office.

Context Sentence JP: 昨今は就職氷河期だと言われているが、会社を選ばなければどこかには就職できるはずである。
Context Sentence EN: They say it's been a hard time for job seekers these days, but I'm sure you should be able to find a job if you're not picky about the company you work for.

Context Sentence JP: 昨日の夜は、よくねむれた？
Context Sentence EN: Did you sleep well last night?

Context Sentence EN: It was Labor Day in the U.S. and Canada yesterday.

Context Sentence EN: We had to read many epic poems yesterday for a university assignment.

Context Sentence JP: 今日の昼、あそこの定食屋でお昼一しょに食べようよ。
Context Sentence EN: Why don't we eat lunch together at that diner during our lunch break today?

Context Sentence JP: 目ざまし時計が鳴らなくて、起きたらすでに昼だった。
Context Sentence EN: My alarm didn't go off and it was already noon when I woke up.

Context Sentence EN: I’m going to take a one hour lunch break, so please hold my calls.

Context Sentence JP: 昨日の晩はフグの毒にあたって死ぬところでした。
Context Sentence EN: Last night, I just about died on blowfish poison.

Context Sentence JP: 三日前の晩から毎晩コウイチがゆめに出てきてわたしにWanikaniを買わないと不こうになると耳打ちするんです。
Context Sentence EN: Koichi has appeared in my dreams every night for the last three days, and he whispers in my ear that I will be unhappy if I don't purchase WaniKani.

Context Sentence EN: "Hey, why don’t we go for a drink tonight?" "Sorry, I’m staying sober now."

Context Sentence EN: Good evening. What are you doing in a place like this?

Context Sentence EN: "Oh hey, good evening." "Good evening." "How was the meeting with the president yesterday?" "Well, I was certain I would be promoted, but I was fired instead."

Context Sentence EN: Good evening, Uncle Koichi. Thank you for taking care of our baby today. Hey, you didn’t microwave that, did you? Because it’s breast milk, you’re not supposed to do that.

Context Sentence JP: 体を丈夫にするために、毎晩やく用酒を飲んでいます。
Context Sentence EN: In order to improve my health, I drink medicinal alcohol every night.

Context Sentence JP: 私の夫は、毎晩五時に夕食を食べて、十時には寝ます。
Context Sentence EN: Every night my husband eats dinner at 5 o’clock and goes to bed by 10 o’clock.

Context Sentence JP: 毎晩泣く子を抱きながら、子供の世話をするには大変な忍耐が必要だということを学びました。
Context Sentence EN: While holding a crying baby every night, I learned that you need a lot of patience to take care of children.

Meaning: To Clear Up, To Become Sunny
Context Sentence JP: 今は雨がふってますけど、二時までには晴れると思いますよ。
Context Sentence EN: It's raining right now, but I think it will clear up by two.

Context Sentence JP: 昨日はよく晴れて良かったですね。
Context Sentence EN: It was good that it ended up being very sunny yesterday.

Meaning: To Clear Up, To Become Sunny
Context Sentence JP: ようやくフグと結婚することになったので、是非式に来てほしいなと思っています。詳細を同封した招待状を後ほどお送りしますね。パーティーは野外の予定なので、当日晴れるといいんだけどな。
Context Sentence EN: I’m finally getting married to Fugu and I want you to be at our wedding. I’ll send you an invitation with all the details later. The reception will be outside, so I hope it’s sunny that day.

Context Sentence JP: 働きすぎは体に毒ですよ。
Context Sentence EN: Working too much is harmful to your body.

Context Sentence EN: Viet is hiding a poison arrow in his desk drawer so that he can assassinate Koichi any time.

Context Sentence EN: While puffer fish is very delicious and provides a deeply satisfying culinary experience, it also carries a deadly poison.

Context Sentence JP: 食中毒でかこきゅうになり、きゅうきゅう病院へはん送されました。
Context Sentence EN: I hyperventilated from food poisoning and had to be taken to the emergency room.

Context Sentence JP: ガス中毒にならないよう気を付けてくださいね。
Context Sentence EN: Be careful not to get gas poisoning.

Context Sentence EN: Fugu tried to rid himself of drug addiction and went to rehab, but eventually ended up relapsing.

Context Sentence JP: ガラガラヘビって有毒なんですか？
Context Sentence EN: Are rattle snakes venomous?

Context Sentence EN: Darin ate a poisonous fungus growing on the side road by mistake and was sent to a hospital.

Context Sentence JP: ビエトだけがコウイチのオナラが有毒ガスのような臭いがすることを知っている。
Context Sentence EN: Only Viet knows that Koichi’s farts smell like toxic fumes.

Context Sentence JP: 食中毒で会社を休んでしまい、大変申しわけありません。
Context Sentence EN: I'm terribly sorry that I took a day off because of food poisoning.

Context Sentence JP: ハーゲンダッツを食べて食中毒を乗りこえるというとても役立つ情ほうを教えてくれて、本当にありがとうございました。
Context Sentence EN: Thank you so much for your helpful information on how to get over food poisoning from eating Häagen-Dazs.

Context Sentence JP: フグが私に食中毒の危険性をレクチャーしてくれたんだけどさぁ、説明がすっごく分かりにくかったんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: Fugu gave me a lecture about the risks of food poisoning, but his explanation was very hard to understand.

Reading: どくがす, どくガス

Context Sentence EN: I read that poison gas was first used in World War I.

Reading: どくがす, どくガス

Context Sentence EN: I'm sorry, but I'm pretty sure that I took the lesson on how to use the poisonous gas at 10:00 a.m. Can you recheck that, please?

Context Sentence JP: 「この野郎！また屁をこきやがったな！毒ガスのように臭いじゃねえか。」「すみません。もう二度とおならはしません。」「いいや、きっとまたこくさ。もう堪忍袋の緒が切れた。お前は首だ。」「そんな〜。」

Context Sentence JP: ビエトには、その方法はきかないっていうか、むしろぎゃくこうかですよ。
Context Sentence EN: That method doesn't work on Viet. It actually works the other way around.

Context Sentence EN: I'm looking for a Japanese grammar book.

Context Sentence EN: The more grammar you learn, the better your writing will become.

Context Sentence EN: My boss looks like a smart person, so it’s too bad that he always makes grammar mistakes.

Context Sentence EN: None of the Tofugu workers know about the illegal black-market transactions that Viet does.

Context Sentence EN: We can’t use evidence obtained through an unlawful search at the court.

Context Sentence JP: ヤバイ。うれしすぎて、泣きそう。
Context Sentence EN: Aww. I'm so happy I'm about to burst into tears!!

Context Sentence JP: 情けないことに、晴れのぶ台で泣いてしまった。
Context Sentence EN: It's shameful that I cried onstage in public.

Context Sentence JP: 減給になっちゃって泣いてます。もっと給料のいい会社に移りたいよ。
Context Sentence EN: I’m crying because my salary was cut. I want to transfer to a higher paying job.

Context Sentence JP: この海は浅いから子どもも安心して泳げます。
Context Sentence EN: This beach is shallow, so even kids can swim safely here.

Context Sentence JP: 考えの浅い人間にはなりたくありません。
Context Sentence EN: I don't want to become a person with shallow thoughts.

Context Sentence JP: 酔っ払うと、眠りが浅くなっちゃって、早朝覚醒しちゃうんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: Whenever I get drunk, I only get light sleep and wake up early in the morning.

Context Sentence JP: うちの猫は、暗算がとく意なんです。
Context Sentence EN: Our cat is good at doing math in its head.

Context Sentence JP: このクローゼットにあるりょうの四倍の猫の服が家にあります。
Context Sentence EN: I have four times the amount of cat clothes in this closet at home.

Context Sentence JP: 助けてくれ！俺の飼い猫がスクラブルの ’M’のコマを飲み込んじゃったんだ！
Context Sentence EN: You’ve got to help me! My cat swallowed an "M" Scrabble tile!

Context Sentence JP: その子猫は、えだからえだを軽かいにとびうつりました。
Context Sentence EN: The kitten jumped nimbly from branch to branch.
