Context Sentence EN: It seems like the likelihood of it snowing on Christmas Day is very high.

Context Sentence JP: 思いついた考えは、どれも実現の可能性は無さそうでしたが、私達はそう簡単には諦めませんでした。
Context Sentence EN: None of the ideas we came up with sounded likely, but we didn’t give up easily.

Context Sentence EN: People in Texas are very friendly, aren't they!

Context Sentence EN: There are some people who make fun of my dad for being a pizza delivery man, but I’m very proud of him.

Context Sentence EN: My mom always did housework quietly and mechanically.

Context Sentence EN: The duchess gracefully entered the room and kissed the duke.

Context Sentence EN: Please add two cups of milk and stir slowly.

Context Sentence EN: Can you include Koichi-kun in your group too?

Context Sentence EN: My turn came at last and I was able to participate in the game.

Context Sentence EN: It’s been a while since I participated in a drinking party and I’m really enjoying it. I’m feeling super-charged!

Context Sentence EN: My house was burned in a fire.

Context Sentence EN: This bread is toasted well.

Context Sentence EN: "This meat is thick, so I think it'll be a while until it's cooked." "I think it'll cook while you're doing the dishes."

Context Sentence EN: Please turn off all personal electronic devices or set them to airplane mode on this plane. Thank you for your cooperation.

Context Sentence EN: We manually check electronic equipment one by one to make sure there are no defects.

Meaning: To Contact, To Get In Touch, To Get In Contact

Context Sentence EN: I'll get in touch with you after I'm fired.

Context Sentence EN: I want to cut ties with you, Koichi, so please never contact me again.

Context Sentence EN: Sorry, I’ve gotta go. I'll check my schedule and get back to you.

Context Sentence JP: 意外にも、父はすぐにさん成してくれました。
Context Sentence EN: Unexpectedly, my dad approved of it right away.

Context Sentence EN: Liking soft pasta that's been cooked too long was an unexpected aspect of Canadian culture.

Context Sentence JP: フグは物凄く走るの速いよ。海ではあまり良いスイマーじゃなかったってことと、大学に入るまで陸上での競技に出たことがなかったってのは、本当に意外だよ。
Context Sentence EN: Fugu is a really fast runner. The surprising thing is, he was never a good swimmer in the sea and never raced on land until he was in college.

Context Sentence EN: I like Japanese anime voice actors but I have no interest in foreign ones.

Context Sentence JP: げんざいの最大の関心は何ですか？
Context Sentence EN: What is your greatest concern at the moment?

Context Sentence EN: Thank you for your interest in our company, Tofugu, and our products.

Context Sentence EN: This game will be released tomorrow.

Context Sentence EN: Tofugu is currently still working to catch up in the pillow market, so they started selling new models.

Context Sentence JP: このドレスは、曲線を美しく出してくれます。
Context Sentence EN: This dress gives me beautiful curves.

Context Sentence EN: The curve of Koichi's butt protruding from the speedo is very... nice!

Context Sentence JP: あなたが怒った時の、ほおの柔らかく歪んだ曲線が好きよ。
Context Sentence EN: I really love the soft, slanted curve of your cheek when you get mad.

Context Sentence EN: Hearing that it would be possible for me to put my daughter in daycare this spring lifted a huge weight off my shoulders.

Context Sentence JP: もう少し実げん可能なかい決さくをていあんしてください。
Context Sentence EN: Please present a few more possible solutions.

Context Sentence EN: I’d say earning a hundred million dollars a year is possible.

Context Sentence EN: The temperature fell suddenly.

Context Sentence EN: Today's highest temperature will be 40 degrees.

Context Sentence JP: 朝ばんの気温のさがはげしいんです。
Context Sentence EN: There is a large temperature gap between morning and night.

Context Sentence EN: When I went there ten years ago, there weren't any lodgings like this at all.

Context Sentence JP: 宿がまだ決まってないんだよ。
Context Sentence EN: We still haven’t decided on a hotel yet.

Context Sentence EN: This inn is historically famous as well, so not only do inn guests visit but sightseers do as well.

Context Sentence JP: ずい分シメサバについて詳しいんですね。
Context Sentence EN: You are quite the expert on mackerel sushi.

Context Sentence EN: I'm sorry, but I'm not an expert when it comes to guns, so it would be better if I didn't touch them.

Context Sentence EN: "Oh, by the way, did you hear they’re getting married?" "Wow! Really? Tell me everything."

Context Sentence EN: This user often sends us very detailed feedback.

Context Sentence EN: Mr. Koichi, I heard you were born poor. Could you give me more details on that?

Context Sentence JP: 詳細を調べている時間がありません。
Context Sentence EN: I don’t have enough time to look up the details.

Context Sentence EN: Yesterday, I met a beautiful woman of unknown age.

Context Sentence EN: Wanikani is a monster whose sex is unknown.

Context Sentence JP: 彼ってほんと職業不詳だよね。
Context Sentence EN: His real job is unknown, isn’t it?

Context Sentence EN: What is the fastest and cheapest route to commute from this apartment to Tokyo University?

Context Sentence EN: Koichi and Viet secretly keep some good-tasting whiskey in the office.

Context Sentence JP: 少しずつ、色んなしゅるいの美味しいものが食べたいんです。
Context Sentence EN: I like trying little bits of many different tasty dishes.

Context Sentence EN: Recently, a lot of pubs with delicious food have been opening in the Tofugu office.

Context Sentence JP: オペラ劇を観劇しに行く天皇へい下をお見送りしました。
Context Sentence EN: I saw off the emperor, who was going to see the opera.

Context Sentence EN: The person who plays the role of the horse in Act II Scene III of this play is my older brother.

Context Sentence JP: 隣の席の人が劇の最中にずっと指をポキポキ鳴らしてて、すっごく苛々しました。
Context Sentence EN: The person next to me was constantly cracking their knuckles during the show and it was so annoying.

Context Sentence JP: その映画は悲しすぎて、喜劇というよりは悲劇だ。
Context Sentence EN: The movie is too sad. It should be called a tragedy, not a comedy.

Context Sentence EN: After watching a documentary about Chaplin, the king of comedy, I decided to pursue a career in comedy.

Context Sentence JP: すごく暑かったので、喜劇を観ながらずっと自分をうちわで扇いでいました。
Context Sentence EN: It was so hot that I kept fanning myself while watching the comedy show.

Context Sentence JP: それが悲劇の始まりだった。
Context Sentence EN: It was the beginning of my tragedy.

Context Sentence JP: あんた、悲劇の主人公にでもなったつもり？いつまでもクヨクヨしてたって仕方ないでしょ？
Context Sentence EN: Are you trying to act like the hero of some tragedy? Moping forever won't help anyone.

Context Sentence JP: あなたには悲劇がお似合いよ。
Context Sentence EN: Tragedy suits you.

Context Sentence JP: ダイエットを始めて三ヶ月で体型が劇的に変化しました。
Context Sentence EN: Three months after starting my diet, my body had changed dramatically.

Context Sentence JP: 劇的とまではいかないけれど、売り上げが上がったことは間違いないようです。
Context Sentence EN: While it's not a dramatic increase, it does seem that they received quite a bit of revenue.

Context Sentence EN: I got tears in my eyes when my favorite team won the game with a dramatic home run.

Context Sentence JP: 練習の後、劇団員はみんな汗だくだった。
Context Sentence EN: All of the drama troupe members were sweating after practice.

Context Sentence JP: 劇団四季に入るのが私の目標です。
Context Sentence EN: My goal is to join the Shiki Theater Company.

Context Sentence JP: ドラマでとある劇団に所属する俳優を好きになってから、彼の出演する舞台を観に劇場にまで足を運ぶようになりました。
Context Sentence EN: I started to like an actor who belongs to a theater troupe from watching a drama, so I started going to the theater to watch his shows.

Context Sentence JP: 劇場のロビーで待ち合わせしましょう。
Context Sentence EN: Let's meet up in the theater's lobby.

Context Sentence JP: それでは劇場のトイレで会いましょう。
Context Sentence EN: I’ll see you at a bathroom in the theater then.

Context Sentence EN: My daily commute to the theater is over two hours each way.

Context Sentence EN: This opera's main character is a natural-born Frenchman.

Context Sentence JP: とある歌劇で、奴隷の役を演じました。
Context Sentence EN: I played the role of a slave in an opera.

Context Sentence JP: 歌劇のチケットの値段を2%値上げします。
Context Sentence EN: We are going to increase our opera ticket prices by 2%.

Context Sentence JP: 彼がトムさんです。
Context Sentence EN: He is Tom.

Context Sentence JP: 彼、とってもおもしろい人なんですよ。
Context Sentence EN: He is a very interesting person.

Context Sentence JP: 今日は彼とおうちデート♡
Context Sentence EN: Today is a home date with my boyfriend♡

Context Sentence EN: Shit! I just broke the stupid teapot. He would get so upset if he knew.

Context Sentence EN: Hey, isn't that Kaoru's boyfriend?

Context Sentence EN: I got this necklace from my boyfriend.

Context Sentence JP: え、彼氏できたの？
Context Sentence EN: Oh, you got a boyfriend?

Context Sentence EN: You know what, I get in a good mood just from talking to you. You really are my ideal boyfriend.

Context Sentence JP: 彼らはみんな、カナダ人なんですよ。
Context Sentence EN: They are all Canadians.

Context Sentence JP: これから、彼らとホッケーをしに行くところなんです。
Context Sentence EN: I am about to go play hockey with them.

Context Sentence JP: 彼らとは、メープルファームで出会いました。
Context Sentence EN: I met them at a maple farm.

Context Sentence EN: None of them bought train tickets and they were caught for riding without paying.

Context Sentence JP: ここは私が代わりに払っておきます！
Context Sentence EN: I’ll pay on your behalf for now.

Context Sentence JP: えっと、シャンパンとキャビアの代金を払えるほどお金を持っていない気がするんですが。
Context Sentence EN: Well, I don’t think I have enough money to pay for champagne and caviar.

Context Sentence EN: Take every precaution for your safety.

Context Sentence EN: When you become an adult, it's difficult to change your way of thinking.

Context Sentence JP: あっ、フグのくちびるの形は変えないでください。それはコウイチの好物のタラコをモチーフにしているんです。変えたらコウイチが悲しみます。
Context Sentence EN: Oh, please do not change the shape of Fugu's lips. They were inspired by Koichi's favorite food, cod roe. If you change them, Koichi will be sad.

Context Sentence EN: When you change the shape of your eyebrows, you look like a different person.

Context Sentence EN: She is Hana.

Context Sentence JP: 彼女とディズニーランドに行ってきた。
Context Sentence EN: I went to Disneyland with my girlfriend.

Context Sentence JP: 俺の彼女、めっちゃかわいいだろ？
Context Sentence EN: My girlfriend is so cute, isn’t she?

Context Sentence JP: 彼女は服のセンスがいい。
Context Sentence EN: She has good taste in clothes.

Context Sentence JP: あの人、誰かな？
Context Sentence EN: Who is that person?

Context Sentence JP: 次は誰の番？
Context Sentence EN: Whose turn is it next?

Context Sentence JP: え、それ、誰が言ったの？
Context Sentence EN: Oh, who said that?

Context Sentence EN: "I wonder who that girl is." "You don’t know her name? She sits behind you in class!"

Context Sentence EN: "Oh, there's someone over there." "Uh, there’s no one there…?"

Context Sentence JP: 誰かに聞いてみよう！
Context Sentence EN: Let's ask someone!

Context Sentence EN: Did someone in my family accuse that excellent surgeon of contributing to our mom’s death?

Context Sentence EN: I'll have a draft beer.

Context Sentence JP: こいつ、俺のツレなんだ。
Context Sentence EN: He's my buddy.

Context Sentence JP: あ、いいよ、俺がやるから。
Context Sentence EN: Oh, that's okay, I'll do it.

Context Sentence EN: If you feel like it, how about going to karaoke with us now?

Context Sentence JP: 俺ら、今、ちょうど学校出たとこだよ。
Context Sentence EN: We just got out of school.

Context Sentence JP: え、俺ら、それはちょっとムリだわ。
Context Sentence EN: Oh, we're not sure we can do that.

Context Sentence JP: ごめん。 俺らがこの会話をするのは明らかにすごく早すぎたよな。でも、ただ、俺はお前と結婚したいと思ってるってこと、言いたかったんだ。
Context Sentence EN: I’m sorry. It’s obviously way too early for us to be having this conversation, but I just wanted to tell you that I want to marry you.

Context Sentence JP: 俺たち、一年生です。
Context Sentence EN: We're freshmen.

Context Sentence JP: それ、俺たちのバイクです。
Context Sentence EN: Those are our motorcycles.

Context Sentence JP: 誰もやらないんだったら、俺たちがやるしかないだろ！
